name: Indigenous North American Music
description: Diverse styles and genres developed by the indigenous peoples of present-day Canada, the United States and northwestern Mexico.

children.name: Athabaskan Fiddling
children.description: Fiddle playing of the Northern Athabaskan Dene people of modern-day Alaska, the Yukon, and the Northwest Territories.

children.name: Athabaskan Fiddling
children.description: Fiddle playing of the Northern Athabaskan Dene people of modern-day Alaska, the Yukon, and the Northwest Territories.

children.name: Inuit Music
children.description: Traditions of the Inuit people, the aboriginal peoples inhabiting the Arctic regions of Canada, Alaska, and Greenland.

children.name: Inuit Music
children.description: Traditions of the Inuit people, the aboriginal peoples inhabiting the Arctic regions of Canada, Alaska, and Greenland.

children.name: James Bay Fiddling
children.description: Fiddle playing of the James Bay Cree people, characterised by a fusion of Scottish style with Cree rhythms.

children.name: James Bay Fiddling
children.description: Fiddle playing of the James Bay Cree people, characterised by a fusion of Scottish style with Cree rhythms.

children.name: Métis Music
children.description: Music of the indigenous Métis people of Canada and the United States.

children.name: Métis Music
children.description: Music of the indigenous Métis people of Canada and the United States.

children.name: Powwow Music
children.description: Drum-based traditional music of Plains region Native American tribes, traditionally played at Pow-wows.

children.name: Powwow Music
children.description: Drum-based traditional music of Plains region Native American tribes, traditionally played at Pow-wows.

children.name: Pueblo Music
children.description: Rooted in the traditions of the Pueblo peoples, who are indigenous to the southwest United States.
